bibl.title: Letter from J.B. Harper to Mabel H. Lazear, December 1, 1930

div1.p: Harper informs Mabel Lazear that her annuity will now be paid by the Veterans' Bureau.

div1.head: Letter from J.B. Harper to Mabel H. Lazear, December 1, 1930
div1.opener:
FINANCE DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES ARMY
FINANCE OFFICE
WASHINGTON
IN REPLY REFER TO 004.6 (Lazear, Mrs. Mabel H.)
P&MB***MFC-FLB.
Subject: Annuities.
December 1, 1930.
TO: Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear,
#6 Oak Vale Avenue,
Berkeley, California.
div1.p:
1. You are advised that, beginning with December 1930, the
award to you for participation in the yellow fever experiments in
Cuba, will be paid by the “United States Veterans Bureau, Finance
Division, Washington, D.C.”, and any correspondence, if necessary,
should hereafter be addressed to that office. The cards which
were mailed to you to report on the last day of the month, should
be destroyed.

2. Check covering payment for November 1930, is inclosed
herewith. This office wishes to thank you for your cooperation
in the past.
div1.closer:
For The Finance Officer: J.B. HARPER,
Major, Finance Department. Inclosure.
